document_data.name: ''Black Blades of the Barons''
document_data.author: [[Tarla Semmurt]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Black Blades of the Barons''''' was a stage play penned by [[Tarla Semmurt]], [[Bard]] of [[Yhaunn]], in the beginning of the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|'Tis never a question if she'll go too far. 'Tis always an asking of how soon, and how much wreckage will ensue. Gentlesirs, I'd rather kiss a spike-studded [[viper]] than ally with such a one. Yet, lords, you must suit yourselves—after all, you might love pain.|Nahlvur the Bowman, in Act II, Scene II}}
document_data.History: ''Black Blades of the Barons'' consisted of two or more acts and featured the character named Nahlvur the Bowman. The play was first performed in the {{YearlinkName|1409}}.
